name: Ray Chiang
position: Partner at Dentons Rodyk
about: Ray Chiang is a Partner in the Dentons Rodyk Corporate group. Ray's main areas of practice include corporate and commercial law and employment law. Ray handles commercial transactions including mergers and acquisitions, private equity investments and joint ventures. Ray also handles a wide range of corporate and commercial work and provides compliance advice to various companies and multinational corporations in areas like data protection and competition law. The work he has done in his general corporate practice includes corporate restructurings, capital reduction exercises, share buyback exercises and statutory amalgamations. Ray's experience includes a stint with a Fortune 500 multinational corporation in the communications industry. During this stint, he assisted with procurement and distribution contracts, tenders and policy review. In his employment practice, Ray has done a wide range of work including the drafting of senior executive employment contracts, drafting and reviewing of employment handbooks, assisting with negotiations with trade unions and advising on industrial relations laws in Singapore, advising on employment laws and issues including restraint of trade, retrenchment and retrenchment benefits, termination of employment, summary dismissal, suspensions and garden leave, and transfer of employment in transfers of business.

recommendations: Parth Pareek ‚ÄúI had the opportunity to work with Manoj at Loopin, where he was responsible for driving user acquisition and early growth. Manoj did a great job at ideating and executing the growth strategy. He is one of the most sincere and dedicated individuals I've had the chance to work with. He is passionate, quickly grasps new concepts, and doesn't shy away from taking new initiatives.‚Äù

Ragul Sundaram ‚ÄúMonoj is an exceptionally great learner and tries to share the knowledge he has gained over his years of experience. He has helped a lot of people including me to land their dream job or shine in their respective areas of expertise. His product knowledge is very in-depth and on point. A good speaker and a great listener‚Äù

Jimmy Zamani ‚ÄúManoj is a passionate, hardworking and talented product marketer. He constantly has his finger on the pulse and is testing new strategies to measure results. Having worked with Manoj I am confident that he can understand the product quickly and can create strategies to meet company goals.‚Äù
Abdulaziz Algain ‚ÄúUnparalleled passion for product and growth, organized yet creative, a real pleasure to work with. ‚Äù

Praveen Thirumurugan ‚ÄúManoj worked with GDG Cloud Coimbatore and on few projects with my team. He is an inspirational person with lot of insights in his head. For sure he brings a lot of different perspectives and ideas to the table be it for the community or for the business. His urge for product management and UX is also to be noted in this recommendation as I have witnessed it very close. Your search for a unique and talented person to shape your product should end here.‚Äù

Nalini Krishnan ‚ÄúWorked with Manoj very closely in Ajira & CASA where he was doing his 1 year internship. Once considering the project criticality, he immediately returned to office after finishing his semester exams. He picked the complete responsibility of the mobile version for the product and spearheaded its delivery right from gathering requirements till collaborating with Devs to get the fixes done. He took up design ownership to bring out the revised version of the company's website. Also acted as a facilitator during inceptions. He proactively created posts, videos and managed the media handle of the company. He is very passionate, quick learner, committed and an asset to wherever he is a part of.‚Äù

Dheeraj Mehndiratta ‚ÄúManoj got a level of dedication which is highly commendable, His keen interest in understanding the product & mapping the user journey is helping Merge intern to develop the product in a better direction. Feeling proud to have Manoj in our team.‚Äù
Jai Sadana ‚ÄúExcellent Work with great passion‚Äù

Anirudh Chaudhari üêç ‚ÄúHe has written tutorials on CSEstack.org. He hones different programming skills, and eager to dwell into new technologies. He is very passionate to know what's going around and looks forward to give back to the community. Kudos!‚Äù

experience.title: Product Design Lead
experience.subtitle: Zencargo
experience.description: As a founder designer, I was responsible for leading the design efforts for the company from the very beginning. This included creating the overall visual direction and design language for the product, as well as working closely with the development team to ensure that the design was implemented correctly. I conducted competitor analysis to understand the landscape of the freight forward industry and identify areas where our product could stand out. I worked closely with the founder and other stakeholders to understand the freight forward industry and the specific problems that our product aimed to solve. I kick off with the get quote and book shipment module to reduce back and forth between sales and customer interactions. This was an important module as it was the first point of contact for the customer and needed to be as user-friendly as possible. I also kick off with the dashboard project to allow users to have an overall visibility for their shipments, this allowed customers to have an overview of their shipments and allowed them to quickly access the information they needed. I continued working on shipment pages to expand on getting detailed information like tracking shipment, Cross-Team Collaboration, Document Management, and schedule delivery. This helped to streamline the process for the customer and made it easier for them to keep track of their shipments. I also worked on Purchase Order Management module, this allowed customers to manage their purchase orders efficiently and effectively, which helped to improve the overall customer experience. I hired and coordinated with freelancer designers to help with the workload and bring fresh perspectives to the design process. I also managed the workflow and deadlines of the freelancers to ensure that the design was delivered on time and to the required standard.

name: Saptarshi Prakash
position: Director of Design at Swiggy | TEDx Speaker | YouTuber | Delivered 90+ UX Talks | Ex Zeta, Housing | I judge a book by its cover
about: I love solving problems. Be it counselling a heart-broken friend or breaking my head to build a complex UX flow - I do them all. I am an Engineer from the prestigious Indian Institute of Technology Madras but I chose Digital Experience Designing as my profession because problem-solving can go well beyond the limits of engineering. As a professional, I have worked with some of the well known startups of India like Housing.com, Zeta and many other big and small names around the world. I presently oversee Consumer Design at Swiggy, India‚Äôs largest food ordering and delivery platform. Also, I have delivered 50+ UX talks / workshop at various places including big names like Amazon, Grab, Shopee, Practo, IDC IIT Bombay, IIT Guwahati, NID Bangalore etc. When I am not designing, I am either drafting my next design talk, or travelling in some far off country. If you think I sound interesting, drop me a message. We can catch up over a cup of coffee :)

I'd recommend him to anyone!‚Äù

Nandita Vadali ‚ÄúI have worked with Saptarshi as a Core Group Member at Mitr, IIT Madras. He is a very efficient and proactive team leader. He has taken the initiative to help several students in serious problems in the campus, at any time of the day. His design skills and website management skills were a huge asset to the team. He incorporated a new documentation system (based on ISO 9001:2008 standards), towards certification for the group's activities. He also introduced and actively organized several new events like Emoticon 360 fest with several competitions for the students, flash mob in IIT Madras, interactive mock quiz for freshers and many inspiring talks. experience.description: Framebench is a real time visual review application to help you get quick feedback on any file you produce both internally and with your clients. It effectively tracks these iterations so that you can get work done much faster and stay on top of expectations and deadlines. It is a completely cloud hosted solution where users can quickly share their files which become interactive once online. Participants can then leave text and graphical comments on these files which are transmitted to all other participants in real time. Users can thus give approvals, comments, corrections which can be tracked efficiently.

name: Saad Syed
about: Saad optimizes the reliability and efficiency of cloud-scale distributed systems to unlock strategic revenue opportunities and improve margins. Saad is working on Google Compute Engine to serve Enterprise users by delivering VM and Baremetal instances with state of the art security, reliability, performance and efficiency. Previously, Saad was tasked with advancing infrastructure and product development across Stripe, leverage best practices and guardrails that enables Stripe's economic infrastructure to be efficient, reliable by design, global and highly available for its 1M+ customers. Before that Saad served as VP of Engineering in Azure Core at Microsoft. He developed and helped scale Azure's IaaS Control Plane (Fabric Controller) & Infrastructure from a benchtop to millions of servers in 150+ datacenters worldwide. To meet the growing demands of the business, he led architectural investments to improve scalability by 100x resulting in improvements to Azure's reliability and performance for it's most demanding hyperscale and enterprise customers while unlocking limitless possibilities for data center efficiency. Saad was a member of Azure (codename "RedDog") since its inception. He has developed core services in both the virtualization and baremetal stacks. As a manager he has kickstarted efforts across both the Azure control and data plane infrastructure; in addition to virtualization these include networking, baremetal, authentication and identity, datacenter bootstrap and disaster recovery services.

name: Milind Sanghavi
about: Milind is a seasoned Payments leader with 20+ years of experience building various business units - including multiple Verticals, Merchant and Consumer portfolios across Southeast Asia, India and North America. He built PayPal's business in multiple high value verticals across APAC including managing the end-to-end P&L for the Growth Verticals. Prior to this he built and managed the Merchant business for PayPal across Southeast Asia and India. His portfolio included all aspects of the Merchant Marketing P&L including driving merchant awareness, acquisition and retention. Milind was also responsible for managing and optimizing the website to drive engagement, customer lifetime value and grow online revenues. He also built out various "start-up" concepts for the Southeast Asia business. He has also been key in growing PayPal‚Äôs India business, managing regulatory issues to rebuild the platform for growth since 2011. Prior to moving to Asia, Milind focussed on PayPal‚Äôs North America merchant business. He developed the go-to-market strategies for innovative product solutions that continue to increase SMB/SME acquisition and retention. As a key member of JP Morgan‚Äôs transition team for WaMu, Milind lead the Center of Excellence for retail banking and credit card statements - driving monetization and marketing operations. Milind spent 9+ years across various credit card marketing roles, across portfolio profitability, financial planning and customer retention Selected to 2012 eBay/PayPal Club Excellence (President's Club) Specialties: Real Time Payments Account to Account payments Mobile Payments Growth Hacking E-commerce Intrapreneur based approach to organizations Market Entry Customer Management Strategy Business Development Customer Acquisition mCommerce Merchant Acquisition, Activation & Engagement Portfolio Optimization, P&L Management Product Innovation and Management OmniChannel Strategy

recommendations: Aman Narain ‚ÄúMilind is a triple threat, to borrow a sporting / entertainment analogy, with a unique ability to navigate across banks, payments and startups. The result is someone who can solution creatively like a startup, ensure it is applicable universally given his experience working across the US/APAC and deliver it pushing the boundaries of speed and agility at a Bank. Working closely with Milind over the last year I have had the pleasure of seeing that all happen in parallel as he was instrumental in OCBC's ground breaking work with Google Pay in Singapore . I have also seen someone who inspires and leads his team by channelling the art of the possible. Those of us who have worked in banking know how much of a team sport this is and Milind is always making sure he takes everyone with him from legal to marketing and especially technology. He does this with his signature jovial disposition and humour which makes the journey that much more fun. It's been a pleasure working with Milind and I am excited to continue working with him to bring easy, intuitive and helpful solutions to consumers around the region.‚Äù

Prasoon Kumar ‚ÄúMilind has been actively mentoring billionBricks for over a year. He is a very patient listener, and is able to come up with quick marketing strategies that can be simply implemented and have been proven to be effective in our work. Among the key areas he helped us is in developing a pitch deck for our shelter project called winterHYDE. This has been well received by our prospective clients and customers, and a lot of his inputs have been widely circulated over our social networks. He has also been actively developing some core strategies for our organization, and providing regular updates to make them consistently result-oriented. ‚Äù

name: Avinash Raghava
position: Love Bringing Awesome People #Together
about: To be yourself in a world that is constantly trying to make you something else is the greatest accomplishment ~ Ralph Waldo Emerson. My passion lies in bolstering the software product/saas eco-system of India. I done my bit to build the Indian product eco-system in the last 15 years. Having played an active role at NASSCOM in starting the Product/Emerge movement, I continued my mission at iSPIRT. I built the much-revered iSPIRT programs like #SaaSx, #PNgrowth, #PNcamp, #PlaybookRT and run the #ProductNation blog and the latest is to drive the SaaS eco-system in India via SaaSBOOMi.com. I also lead the Community Initiatives at Accel in India and part of the team which drives #SeedToScale. I would like to think of myself as a connector, and since I have been in the ecosystem for a long time, I know many smart people who will benefit by being introduced to other smart people. Being able to do that makes me happy and I do it without expecting anything in return. I love my work as it first and foremost about people and relationships, and it is because of these deep friendships that I have been able to learn and grow. Some of the initiatives that I want to drive are the Product Thinking Mindset, an Open Source movement among many other ideas that revolve around transforming India into a Product Nation. I express my thoughts, ideas and dreams at https://medium.com/@avinashraghava

name: Vinnie Lauria
position: Founding Partner, Golden Gate Ventures
about: Vinnie is an entrepreneur turned venture capitalist. In 2011 Vinnie co-founded Golden Gate Ventures, an early-stage VC firm in Southeast Asia with US$250M AUM, 70+ companies, and 8 unicorns in the portfolio. He is a Kauffman Fellow, a Tsinghua University EMBA candidate, and a guest lecturer at the National University of Singapore. Vinnie was awarded Top Startup Mentor by the Founder Institute, from a pool of 2,500 mentors. Prior to setting up Golden Gate Ventures, Vinnie built two startups in Silicon Valley: Meetro, a location-based chat service which was dissolved with many lessons learned in 2007; and Lefora, a forum hosting platform which grew to over 100,000 communities and was acquired by CrowdGather in 2010. He founded the Silicon Valley NewTech meetup, featuring hundreds of startups pitching to a monthly audience w/ more than 10,000 members. Earlier in his career, Vinnie spent four years within IBM, helping to shape how IBM was approaching social software for the enterprise. Vinnie is a graduate of Boston University‚Äôs College of Engineering. Vinnie is passionate about building startup ecosystems and joined his first startup while still in high school.

experience.title: World Explorer
experience.subtitle: UrbanHikers
experience.description: I was fortunate enough to take on the adventure of a lifetime... I spent one year traveling around Asia, immersing myself in new cultures, trying new foods, and at times, building bridges back to silicon valley. **Adventuring** I spent 10 days driving an auto-rickshaw (tuk tuk) over 1,000km across India. I ventured 4,014km high to to tallest city in the world - Litang, China. I rocked out to Beijing underground hip hop, scooted around the island of Taiwan, and explored the jungles of Borneo and Laos! I was invited to personally join the Sultan of Yogakarta, Indonesia for a New Year's festival. I took a 10 day vow of silence to learn Vipassana meditation, and spent 2 weeks living at a buddhist monastery, studying Kung Fu under Shaolin monks. **Geeking** I met with fellow geeks and entrepreneurs in a dozen cities through Asia. I had the opportunity to meet the most interesting people, from fellow tech geeks to jailed Tibetans, to village chiefs, to travelers biking their way around the world!

experience.title: Software Developer
experience.subtitle: National Arbitration & Mediation
experience.description: I started at NAM while still just a student in high school. We set out to build a litigation system on the web that could automate many of the costly processes involved in arbitration or mediation. It was a blind auction system, like an 'ebay' for insurance providers and people trying to settle their claims. The traditional model moved very slowly and was very costly, so we set out to make it simple and more enjoyable. However, we lost out to a competitor alongside the dotcom boom. recommendations: Qin En Looi ‚ÄúI had the privilege of working with Izzy for the recruitment of Entrepreneur First's 3rd batch, and would unhesitatingly place Izzy in the top 1% of talent attraction managers I have encountered. Izzy built and mentored the talent team at Entrepreneur First from scratch, growing the team from 2 to 8 over 3 months. As a highly-vested manager who cares a great deal for her team members, Izzy was highly meticulous in onboarding me, and offered excellent feedback during my first recruiting conversations. Her enthusiasm for leveraging on my strengths was contagious and motivated me, whilst being constructive over areas for improvement. Even when experiments failed, she was encouraging and supportive, rallying the entire team behind to identify how we can improve the recruitment processes. In addition to her inspirational managerial capabilities, Izzy is a superb closer. Her ability to read people, connect with them and understand their point of view is phenomenal -- that the team surpassed our targets of 100 offers made for EFSG3 bears testament to her knack for connecting well with professionals from diverse backgrounds and make them feel at ease quickly. I would relish the opportunity to work with Izzy again in future, and she's definitely a force to reckon with!‚Äù

Vincent Tan ‚ÄúIzzy was an outstanding mentor during my internship at Entrepreneur First. Even though I was new to the field of technical recruiting and sourcing, Izzy guided me perfectly such that I was sourcing the most talented individuals in Singapore on my own within a week, a testament to her knowledge on sourcing effectively as well as the Singapore talent landscape. As a manager, Izzy constantly made sure that effective communication was the top priority, which helped shaped proper goal setting and progress tracking. The most impressive skill of Izzy's was her ability to inspire people to apply for the EF programme - these computer scientists and engineers, most with PhDs and incredible accomplishments, had never heard of EF before, but after a mere 45 minute conversation with Izzy, I saw many of them seriously contemplating leaving their jobs to join the EF programme. Having talked to many of the founders that have completed the programme, it is clear that most of their journeys started solely because of the impact of Izzy's initial meeting. I believe this is because Izzy is able to relate extremely well to the people she speaks to and at the same time display a genuine appreciation for the talent that they have. I can proudly say that most of the skills and knowledge I gained from my internship can be attributed to Izzy, who was a great leader, mentor and colleague. I look forward to working with her again. ‚Äù

experience.subtitle: Information Sciences Institute
experience.description: Worked as a Visiting Research Intern in the Information Integration Group with Prof. Craig Knoblock and Prof. Pedro Szekely under the USC Viterbi-India Research Fellowship Program. Developed a new approach for the problem of assigning semantic labels to data sources according to a given underlying ontology, a key step in the larger problem of data integration. Experiments show that our approach has higher label prediction accuracy, lower time complexity than existing systems and is also capable of handling noise in data sources. The work was published and presented at the 12th Extended Semantic Web Conference (ESWC) 2015, Portoroz Incorporated the above semantic typing approach as a module in Karma, an open-source information integration tool being developed at ISI.

about: I‚Äôve spent the last 20+ years working in technology in London, Silicon Valley and now Ireland. I am the CTO of Algolia, the market leader in AI powered search and discovery - serving 17,000+ companies and trillions of customer experiences every year. The team have built the only scalable hybrid AI search engine in the world, which combines keyword and vector-based semantic search, available to developers via a single API. Previously, I acted as the CIO for Stripe in Europe and led a global engineering organisation overseeing the development and operations of 40+ local payment methods across Europe, Asia, and the Americas that processed hundreds of billions of dollars. I am passionate about helping startups, particularly in Ireland. I angel invest as a Sequoia Scout and advise Elkstone Ventures Irish seed fund. I serve on the board of Manna Drone Delivery and mentor founders + CTOs on scaling product & engineering. I am involved in the crypto community and advised the European Central Bank on the technical design of the digital Euro. My team built critical infrastructure, algorithms and experiences for 35 million customers in 17 countries like personalised search, browsing and recommendations. Over 7 years at Google, I built and led teams working on strategy, operations, big data and machine learning. The highlight was the 3 years I spent in Silicon Valley working at Google X launching Wing, a ‚Äúmoonshot‚Äù involving autonomous drones that deliver food. Prior to Google, I was a serial entrepreneur, founding 3 startups in 10 years, the most successful being Masabi which now processes > $1bn+ in train tickets per year. I have a degree in Computer Science from Cambridge University.

experience.title: Director
experience.subtitle: Haldivita
experience.description: Haldivita is a company focused on research and creation of healthy Turmeric based products. A start up founded by Sameer Gupta and Ankit Khanduri and assisted by a diverse group of friends and family, who came together with a vision to bring non-chemical farm produce to our customers. . We are headquartered in Delhi with our research and manufacturing facility based at the foothills of Himalayas, in the beautiful city of Dehradun. Our products are centered around Turmeric and we source this directly from the farmers from the higher regions of Badrinath in Chamoli district. This ensures fresh and unadulterated supply, assists in increased the income of marginal farmers who have small land holdings. As we move on, we are developing more organic product variants that help in building immunity and bringing the time tested Ayurveda recipes. All or bringing significant benefits of turmeric and curcumin to masses and making sure that the farmers get the right returns for the produce.

Open and approachable, he sees the value of investing in others, building others up by sharing actively his experience in futures and foresight methods. name: Samuel H. Kim
position: Founding President, CALI | Harvard MPA
about: AREAS PASSIONATE ABOUT LEARNING & TEACHING: Adaptive Leadership | Organizational Resilience | Futures Thinking | Moral Leadership | Cross-cultural Negotiations | Power & Influence | Learning Organization ABOUT SAMUEL H. KIM Hi! I am Samuel Hungsoo Kim from Korea. As the Founding President of the Center for Asia Leadership Initiatives [CALI], I oversee three international nonprofit organizations: the Asia Leadership Institute, the Asia Leadership Trek, and Acumen Publishing. I am passionate about nurturing and empowering talent in Asia and run over 60 programs annually, including international conferences, workshops, and seminars in 83 cities in 31 Asian countries, all aimed to help the region‚Äôs emerging leaders explore ways of being socially responsible as they face today‚Äôs complex challenges. I research, teaching, consulting, and coaching focus on Adaptive Leadership, Organizational Resilience, Futures Thinking, Moral Leadership, Learning Organization, Cross-cultural Negotiations, and Power and Influence. To date, some 42,000 burgeoning and established leaders from the governmental, political, non-profit, and corporate spheres in Asia have benefited from my Center's programs. Apart from these programs, I regularly provide keynotes and talks in globally recognized conventions, such as the Asian Leadership Conference, the Asia Leadership Forum, the Jeju Forum, Harvard Model United Nations at Harvard University. Prior to establishing CALI, I worked in a wide range of sectors, from strategy consulting and social entrepreneurship to international development, politics, and government. I have worked for or with over fifty renowned organizations, including the United Nations, UNESCO, Samsung, and Toyota. I also served as a Visiting Fellow at the Asia Center at Harvard University and at the Kellogg School of Management at Northwestern University after I completed my Master‚Äôs degree in Public Administration at the Kennedy School of Government at Harvard University. I am the editor of thirteen books and regularly writes opinion pieces and editorials.

I conduct annually about 50-60 6-18 month-long teaching, consulting, and coaching programs for leading thinkers and decisionmakers based in Asia. They include, among others, the lawmakers, senior government officials, senior leaders of the law enforcements, board members, senior corporate executives, educators, and senior community leaders. To date, served over 42,000 individuals from over 700 organizations I (co)-organize three major conferences (alf.asialeadership.org, alc.chosun.com) in Seoul, Kuala Lumpur, and Kuching, engaging over 320 speakers, and drawing 4,500 participants accumulatively; Aspire to turn Seoul Conference as the Asian version of the World Economic Forum on themes and issues pertinent to the continent; Invited the current Indian Prime Minister Narendra Modi, current Indonesian President Joko Widodo, former US President Barack Obama, former UK Prime Minister David Cameron, former US Vice-President Al Gore as well as other leading political and business figures as Keynote Speakers. I build contents on topics related to leadership, resilience and adaptation, future of work, futures thinking, group dynamics, strategy, decision-making, etc. culminating in publications of 13 books and 16 Harvard Business School-like cases. experience.title: Head Of Engineering @Total built by Hike
experience.subtitle: Hike Messenger
experience.description: Total By Hike works on a proprietary technology developed by Hike called UTP - Universal Transfer Protocol, which enables these services to run with complete User Interfaces as if they were running on internet to provide beautiful, never seen-before experiences without data. When you use star services on TOTAL built by hike phones, UTP does the heavy lifting of encrypting, compressing and transmitting the data quietly behind the scenes. On the other hand, developers write their applications the same way they would for HTTP. Whenever a no-internet connectivity scenario is encountered, UTP automatically kicks in and the app continues to function seamlessly. When developers start developing applications using UTP, we reach out to users who are not on the internet, while not compromising on the user experience. And that opens the doors to making the dream of a truly Digital India a reality a whole lot sooner than later

recommendations: Ian Whiteford ‚ÄúAaron has been a pivotal member of Improbable's growth and success over the last 7 years. He has worn many hats during that time, but one of his biggest contributions has been making us the go-to place for top talent from all over the world and the implementation of innovative hiring methods. His efforts have allowed us to grow from less than 10 people to an internationally distributed company of well over 750 people. He is an inspirational leader for Talent functions and the strength of his team represents the quality of people that want to work with and learn from him. ‚Äù

Andy King ‚ÄúI joined Improbable to work in the Talent team for Aaron. At the time we were around 20 people, no processes, interview structure or systems to manage recruitment. Aaron has managed to turn the Talent function into a smooth running machine that has allowed the company to grow to the Global business it is today. Aaron has ensured that by allowing Improbable the access to the Talent that was needed the business was able to develop the complex product we need to be successful. I may have moved away from recruitment but in my new role running the Global Mobility function, I still worked closely with Aaron. In this position, it gave me a deeper appreciation of Aaron's role and how he helped the company grow. Aaron sets a very high standard and will always push back on anything that does not meet those standards but this is needed if a business is to be able to grow in such an aggressive and successful way. From 20 people to over 800 with offices in three continents is an achievement to be proud of.‚Äù

name: Sanjay Agrawal
position: CEO Cofounder Revefi Inc, a Stealth Startup (#hiring!), ex-cofounder ThoughtSpot
about: We are staunch believers in opportunities around enterprise Data. In Dec 2021, we raised one of the LARGEST SEED ever in the area from a top Bay Area Venture firm partner (Thank you for putting your belief in us) to realize our mission. We have a 3+ years of runway, which is extremely rare for a company at the seed stage. Why this raise? When we set out to build Revefi with the mission to transform the space of business data observability, we laid our requirements on 3 facets to put us on path for building a long lasting company. (1) People, culture - a super positive company that everyone wants to be part of (2) Technical prowess, solid Engineering principles - a place to learn from others, helping others grow (3) Finance - Last but not the least, when we are building something so substantive, a strong runway is imperative to provide our team the means and piece of mind to iterate, and build things the right way. We currently already have a distributed team, with offices in place in both Washington and California! With our foundational team including industry technical leaders (20+ years of Engineering and Product building excellence spanning companies like Google, Meta, Amazon, Microsoft etc.), we are now looking for doers who are driven to learn, to make a difference and be a core part of such an experience to join us on our journey. Interested? Drop me a note and we can talk about our DNA - technical, engineering, data space, our culture. We are looking for zero to one doers, company builders across all disciplines - engineering, product, design to join us! If you thrive in ambiguities, are driven to solve customer problems, and want to get into the weeds of and shape how startups get built on top of building an awesome product itself from scratch, talk to us! Key Experiences: Organizational Leadership 1. Company building - Ex-cofounder of ThoughtSpot a ~4.2B company unicorn in Business Analytics. 2. Started company's Seattle office - Moved to Seattle from CA to start the first Engineering office of TS outside Bay Area at the time. Technical Leadership Drove two key technological areas and underlying stack that differentiated ThoughtSpot's core mission of analytics for all. a) Falcon - Love to discuss WHY we decided and then built a unique in-memory distributed database that ran on 100+ machines to enable company's core mission of search over data warehouse scale, and WHAT/HOW to realize this at such scale b) SpotIQ - HOW to bring the power of PUSH based analytics to complement search, other PULL models to the world of analytics

recommendations: Abhishek Rai ‚ÄúSanjay and I worked closely for nearly 8 years at ThoughtSpot Inc where Sanjay is a Co-Founder. Sanjay played an instrumental role in building the primary and most differentiated product offerings, hiring the engineering team, and acquiring and growing customers. The primary differentiation for ThoughtSpot in the first 5-6 years was interactive search, with the interactivity enabled by a fast homegrown MPP relational database. Sanjay drove its design through novel ideas around in-memory processing, JIT compilation, fast scalable ingest, distributed fault-tolerant architecture, and BI centric query optimization. The second wave of ThoughtSpot product innovation (AI driven insights, aka SpotIQ) was also led by Sanjay. In all Sanjay has the uncanny ability to take on high risk problems and through excellent exploration and execution, de-risk and deliver them. Besides Engineering leadership, Sanjay has an astute mind for product thinking and UX design. He is often involved end to end from product, UX design, Eng, and customer success for initiatives he owns. This ability to intricately connect a real use case to product building and ownership to ultimately drive user adoption in that use case is truly special in Sanjay. Sanjay is also not a person who would just "go with the flow" during ideation sessions. He maintains an independent point of view, even if unpopular, and will routinely challenge the status quo, making for highly effective brainstorming and design thinking sessions. Sanjay also played a pivotal role in building our engineering org globally. He hired several highly capable leaders and engineers across multiple global offices. Post hiring, he always remained closely involved to remove blockers and ensure their success. Sanjay is an outstanding leader who is great with product, customers, and people. He's personally been a valuable mentor to me and so many others. Working with him would be a privilege for anyone.‚Äù

experience.title: Cofounder, Head Seattle office, VP Engineering & Fellow
experience.subtitle: ThoughtSpot
experience.description: Organizational Leadership Part of ThoughtSpot founding/leadership team, helping company grow (600+ now), in establishing our engineering practices and culture, key role in defining & realizing our company product, vision & road map. Working directly with customers (including several fortune 500), sales team during all phases of sales cycle: POC, pre-sales & post sales to help customers succeed. Established & heading our Seattle area office, our first development organization outside Bay Area. Technical Leadership 1. Driving SpotIQ. SpotIQ bridges the gap between search and AI driven analytics to bring the power of both paradigms at the hands of end users. Check https://thoughtspot.com/spotiq for SpotIQ details! 2. Driving backend platform. Conceptualized & developed Falcon, our high performance, scale out, distributed database from scratch for purposes of enabling instant search experience over TBs of enterprise data with consistency and transactional guarantee of database. a) Database system supports complex ad-hoc sql queries (sub-second over billions of rows), and updates (non blocking, multi-billion rows/hr) at extremely high performance. Auto-scaling when nodes are added and vice-versa, resiliency to node, process restarts , hands off administration - critical operational aspects of the system. b) Built the data ingestion pipeline to enable a TB/hr scale-out load speeds within the platform. Key - support multiple parallel super optimized loads to a single table with ACID guarantees. c) Leveraging the stack, further built the ELT framework within TS to enable data transformations at our scale and performance. Primarily for customers who had multi-TBs of data, needed to perform data manipulations for analytics and couldn't get it done at traditional ETL systems. 3. Working with support/operations team in building self-support capabilities in the system to reduce support cost in the field. This is critical to enable us to scale with customer base.

experience.title: Software Engineer
experience.subtitle: Google
experience.description: Ads backend system provided the core and mission critical infrastructure system to enable analysis of Ads related data. The system was distributed and supported massive scalability in terms of "extremely large" data sizes, very high update rates, fault tolerance coupled with strict transactional semantics and with very high querying performance both in terms of latency and throughput. 1. Driving system architecture & development to lower organizational cost by improving resource utilization while maintaining the high throughput and low latency required of the system. 2. Design & develop the next generation analytics system for 100x scale.

experience.title: Principal Research Software Design Engineer/ Lead
experience.subtitle: Microsoft
experience.description: 1. Built & led Conference Management service team. It is a scale out, customizable peer reviewing web based service (http://cmt.research.microsoft.com/cmt). - As manager of the team, built the team from ground up, people management (zero attrition rate) - As chief architect. led all aspects of the service end to end - requirement gathering, software architecture, development, support, operations and release management. - Strongly focused on automation to keep organizational costs low (one support person across 1000+ programs, growing 250K+ active userbase). - Drove external adoption from fewer than 100 to 1000+ programs within 3 years. - Evangelized service within Microsoft to help run several key programs on the service platform. Achieved by making service very versatile & customizable. 2. Led the design and development of Database Tuning Advisor in SQL Server to automate database performance tuning. - Significantly improved scope and scalability (10x-100x speed ups) compared to its predecessor. - Scaled to much more complex environments - 10-100x times number of tables, queries, query complexity. - Driving the work to automate performance tuning in SQL/Cloud scenarios. - In recognition of significant long term impact of this work in both academic and industry, AutoAdmin was awarded the ten year award in VLDB 2007. Developed key technologies in bridging the gap between structured and unstructured data at scale with significant impact in both research & industry specifically for ads, search. 3. Developed Query Portals a system to demonstrate how entities can be used to provide a much richer search experience & its relevance to ads at scale. - Automated entity extraction from web pages (billions of pages, few ms overhead per page). 4. about: I‚Äôm an excited, passionate and innovative escaped accountant. I‚Äôm the professional who has banned the pencil and paper, I live and breathe business efficiencies and automation. Growing up with parents owning a small business and a love for technology, I became a tech-obsessed accountant, I have found a passion for communicating innovative business solutions across a number of different industries. While building a nurturing high performing sales and support team. Where accounting and tech intersect making me the world‚Äôs ultimate geek! Creativity | Constantly on the search for more effective applications and solutions, I love implementing new technology to solve old problems, while empowering my team to come up with innovative solutions. I‚Äôm passionate about facilitating connectivity and delivering a competitive edge to businesses through cloud technologies to simplify processes. Human | My core is to help my team do the best work of their lives, through empowerment and coaching, so that they can reach their full potential. Through aligning business objectives, empowering teams to own their roles, coupled with the effective technology that drives productivity. I am able to drive business results and growth, with a sweet spot for SaaS. Communication | I facilitate solution-centric sales to provide authentic and useful outcomes for my clients and partners. One of my strengths is my ability to translate complex applications through education and through presenting to a variety of businesses from SME owners to executives and government. Relationship management across industries and through varying levels of management is representative of my results focused style.

experience.title: Recruiting
experience.subtitle: Stripe
experience.description: Areas of Focus: - Technical Services at Stripe (Solutions Architects, Integration Engineers, Implementation, and more) - Led Product Recruiting at Stripe 2018-2020. Help scale the Product org from >20 to 50+ Product managers. - Developer Relations, Developer Advocates, and Support Engineers Stripe is a technology platform that developers use to build internet businesses. Thousands of businesses -- ranging from startups to Fortune 500 companies -- rely on Stripe‚Äôs software tools to accept payments, expand globally, and create new revenue streams. Stripe has been at the forefront of expanding internet commerce, powering new business models, and supporting the latest platforms, from mobile marketplaces to social commerce. Stripe was founded in 2010 by John and Patrick Collison, who set out to fix a critical problem: how online businesses could quickly and easily accept payments from anyone, anywhere in the world. Today, merchants in 25 countries can use Stripe to accept payments in 130+ currencies, as well as Apple Pay, Android Pay, Alipay and Bitcoin. By reducing the barriers to starting and operating a business regardless of location or means, Stripe aims to bring more would-be companies online and accelerate the internet economy. Stripe has received around $450 million in funding to date from investors including Sequoia Capital, Andreessen Horowitz, Kleiner Perkins Caufield & Byers, Visa, American Express, and PayPal founders Peter Thiel, Max Levchin, and Elon Musk. For more information, please visit www.stripe.com/press.

Talented, driven, and curious, Eman is as strong a business leader as I've ever worked with.‚Äù

Beth Godlin ‚ÄúEman did a great job this year creating a culture of openness and collaboration while managing a great deal of underlying complexity. She displayed an appreciation for identifying and trouble-shooting challenges while staying firm in her desire to meet goals and challenge the team to meet high growth goals.‚Äù

name: Elycia Teh
position: Recruiting @ Stripe!
about: Growing through the seasons in life, I was sure about 1 thing - I enjoyed helping people grow and making a difference in their lives. My current line of work is all about people. I love being a part of making the workplace a better environment for the ones who spend the bulk of their waking hours here. This comes in the form of hiring great individuals. Individuals who positively impact people and culture, who truly care deeply about the work they do, and the teams they work with. Businesses are made up of its people. My passion to constantly challenge limits and grow through experiences probably came from learning the discipline of Karate from a young age of 8. Taking part in countless tournaments over the years lands me at 30 medals, a black belt, but more importantly has taught me to constantly improve, grow and seek to be better. I was privileged to also have been a recipient of the 2015 National Human Resource Scholarship by the Singapore Ministry of Manpower (MOM). When I'm not doing the above, I find peace in the unknown; trekking through uncharted trails and exploring foreign lands.

about: What I do best is make order out of chaos. I enjoy building businesses and new functions ground up, particularly in emerging markets. I have a proven track record in Sales & Business Development, Product Management, P&L Management and Cross-Geography Team Management. My experience spans multiple geographies - Asia-Pacific markets like S.E. Asia, Australia, India, Korea, Japan and Greater China as well as the United States - specifically around driving partnerships, client development, building products, managing regulatory engagements and scaling operations. I believe that great people and motivated teams are the key to success and have been lucky enough to lead several talented teams through my career. I am regularly invited to present and moderate discussions at leadership meetings, offsite sessions and industry events. Forums I have spoken or presented at include the Global Fintech Festival, SG Fintech Festival, SG Fintech Association, Women in Payments, Interserkt Australia, Fintech New Zealand, Money 2020, American Chamber of Commerce, the Rotary Club of Singapore, the Entrepreneurs Organization Asia and the Human Capital Leadership Institute. I've also evaluated, mentored & advised start ups, most recently as part of the MAS Fintech Awards, Global FinTech Hackcelerator (organized by the Monetary Authority of Singapore) and previously the FinLab Challenge (organized by the UNCDF, Bank Negara Malaysia & Malaysia Digital Economy Corporation). I am passionate about diversity & inclusion issues in the workplace. Most recently I served as a Mentor for the Led By Foundation, a leadership program for the development of young Indian Muslim women. In 2019, I was selected as a Rise Up 'Power Player' honoring the Top 30 Women in Payments in Asia. I am currently a Grassroots Leader for the People‚Äôs Association of Singapore (Balmoral Neighborhood Committee).
